Name: Santa Marta Daiquiri
Ingredients: 70 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
FLOAT a spoon of kirsch eau-de-vie.
Garnish with lime wedge on rim.
Review: A float of Kirsch eau-de-vie adds wonderfully fruity aromatics to an otherwise classic Natural Daiquiri.
History: This adaptation of a Natural Daiquiri was discovered by Joerg Meyer in 2011 in the 1948 edition of the Cuban Cantinero bartender's own journal, El Arte del Cantinero Los Vinos Y Los Licores . Daiquiri cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Santa Marta Daiquiri contains 208 calories
